results.content: One problem I have is the version of Docker CE seems to have been replaced with Docker Desktop which doesn't have all the same options.  For instance, I mounted a volume but I can't see it in Docker Desktop (only command line).  And Hyper V doesn't show any VM's (I'm creating one now).  But I do have a viable application at my company that uses Docker and Visual Studio spins up all the docker instances.  Being a bit old school, I'm trying to get in to them but don't know how.  Hehe.  Maybe the rest of the training will illuminate this.
results.content_html: One problem I have is the version of Docker CE seems to have been replaced with Docker Desktop which doesn't have all the same options. For instance, I mounted a volume but I can't see it in Docker Desktop (only command line). And Hyper V doesn't show any VM's (I'm creating one now). But I do have a viable application at my company that uses Docker and Visual Studio spins up all the docker instances. Being a bit old school, I'm trying to get in to them but don't know how. Hehe. Maybe the rest of the training will illuminate this.

results.content: Awesome course & got good information on Docker
results.content_html: Awesome course & got good information on Docker

results.content: The volume differences between videos is very jolting. One video will be very quiet and muffled, so I turn the volume way up and listen intently to get the information - then suddenly the next video is extremely crisp and loud and blows me out of the door. The information so far is very good, but the volume should be consistent to avoid giving someone a heart attack.

The information so far is very good, but the volume should be consistent to avoid giving someone a heart attack.

results.content: Initially I have underestimated this course but after going thru many other courses I felt this is the best course on docker concepts for some one to understand in an hour and start working on it.
results.content_html: Initially I have underestimated this course but after going thru many other courses I felt this is the best course on docker concepts for some one to understand in an hour and start working on it.

results.content: First few lessons had mixed audio quality. Seems like in rush to complete the course. Need to spend more time to describe the basics of Dockerfile and Compose syntax. Also should have mentioned when to use Linux or Windows VM image, pitfalls of using Toolbox and how to overcome that. How to do scaling using containers etc...
results.content_html: First few lessons had mixed audio quality. Seems like in rush to complete the course. Need to spend more time to describe the basics of Dockerfile and Compose syntax. Also should have mentioned when to use Linux or Windows VM image, pitfalls of using Toolbox and how to overcome that. How to do scaling using containers etc...

results.content:
It was a great course.
The only thing is that explanations are based on a DotNet program (MovieDB) which is not really explained (as said in the course, it is not the subject and I fully agree) and prevent us from experimenting docker-compose during the course until we reach the end where you mention the project on GitHub. Having it mentioned at the beginning of the course would have solved this problem.

results.content:
Ideas all around clarified. Containerization of various dotnet projects with different scenarios, all around clarified! Extremely enjoyed the course! 

I would ask for creator to think of microservice precedent and there dockerizing every one of the projects independently and after that running the application as multiple application containers.
